content.raw:
I just tested this with a high bandwidth topic (/gazebo/default/physics/contacts in sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world was generating over 5 MB/s) and it cut the physics update rate in half. I believe this is because `gztopic echo` is not subscribing to the normal topics and parsing the messages; rather it is subscribing to a special debug topic (/gazebo/default/physics/contacts/__dbg) that causes the publisher to serialize that topic to a string (see [TopicManager.cc:159](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0ddd1f60a8cd5411ba328f5c6265f4a2f9a3f98e/gazebo/transport/TopicManager.cc?at=default#cl-159).

Resolving this issue would involve some substantial changes to gztopic.
content.html:
I just tested this with a high bandwidth topic (/gazebo/default/physics/contacts in sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world was generating over 5 MB/s) and it cut the physics update rate in half. I believe this is because gztopic echo is not subscribing to the normal topics and parsing the messages; rather it is subscribing to a special debug topic (/gazebo/default/physics/contacts/__dbg) that causes the publisher to serialize that topic to a string (see TopicManager.cc:159.

Resolving this issue would involve some substantial changes to gztopic.
